intro: Labordia pallida, commonly known as the pale labordia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pale yellow flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution, Labordia pallida is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
